about_thanks: Remark: I would like to warmly thank Mike Bourkas, the author of the Lifetap application: this web-app is a personal clone, produced simply to practice and learn and experiment with Svelte, TypeScript etc. I heavily used GitHub Copilot and Google Gemini, AI-based "coding assistants", to develop this app.
about_playstore: The app on the Google Play Store

tooltip_commander_damage: Total commander damage received from all players
commander_damage_help: Track damage received from each player's commander. A player loses when taking 21+ combat damage from a single commander.
turn_timer_enabled_help: When enabled, a per-turn countdown is shown for the active player.
long_click_random_player: Tip: long click on the dice (in the main menu) to select a random player!
explanation_emblems_and_dungeons: Display an emblem or a dungeon for your game. Planeswalker emblems and dungeons are game elements that add special rules or conditions to your Magic game. You can search any emblem or dungeon from Scryfall, or choose from a few common emblems:
emblem_ring_preset: The Ring / The Ring Tempts You
emblem_search_noresult: No emblem/dungeon found for this query.
emblem_no_image: No image available for this emblem.
vanguard_mode_enabled: Enable Vanguard mode on new game
treachery_mode_enabled: Enable Treachery mode on new game
vanguard_draft_three: Variant: 3 Vanguard cards then keep one
vanguard_explanation: Vanguard cards are optional role cards that change starting life, hand size, and grant static abilities. In Vanguard mode, each player gets a random Vanguard (uniform, without replacement).
treachery_explanation: In Treachery mode, each player secretly gets a random identity (Leader, Traitor, Assassin, Guardian) based on player count. Each role can be viewed once, then remains hidden.
treachery_official_link: Website with the rules for the Treachery mode (not official WotC)
shogun_nonofficial_link: Website with the rules for the Shogun mode (not official WotC)
vanguard_wiki_link: Read Vanguard rules on MTG Wiki
vanguard_random_rule: Random assignment is uniform and without replacement.
treachery_random_rule: Role distribution: 4 P = 1 Leader, 1 Traitor, 2 Assassins; 5 P = +1 Guardian; 6 P = +1 Assassin +1 Guardian.
shogun_explanation: Shogun variant is a simpler hidden-role mode: each player secretly gets a role (Shogun, Traitor, Assassin, Guardian) based on player count. Roles can be viewed once, then stay hidden.
treachery_hide_after_reading: Close this view after reading: the identity stays hidden after that.
